text: Definitely not that simple. The issue of training is a real one. Concealed carry not enough. Law enforcement officers have to regularly train and recertify. The LEOs in my family have to requalify 3x/year, with 100% accuracy for the rifle test, and guns are their comfort zone.
author: DaviSusan

text: Seems like you get around legal challenges by making it opt-in, not a requirement for employment. Similar to airline pilots. Another consideration: it requires thorough and consistent training. Not a one-and-done session. LEOs have to regularly re-up firearms training.
author: DaviSusan

text: Great point.
author: DaviSusan

text: Weak argument, we're not talking about LEOs, but civilian employment. What about movie theater workers? Shopping mall employees? Can the government require you to arm yourself as a condition of your non-law enforcement job? Opt-in training is one thing, forced-in is another.
